messages.title: Britain faces a clear choice at the next election
messages.content: At the next election there will be a clear choice - a recovery that puts people and the NHS first with Labour, or carrying on with a Conservative Government that does not believe wealth should be used wisely.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Energy bills frozen until 2017, a new lower rate of starting tax, and an £8 minimum wage.
8,000 more doctors, 20,000 more nurses, and a guaranteed GP appointment in 48 hours.
Tough new controls to make sure no one who comes to Britain can claim benefits for at least two years.
A guaranteed job or training for young people out of work for a year, and more apprenticeships.
25 hours free childcare for 3 and 4-year olds with working parents.

mentions.candidate: Only Nick Palmer can beat Anna Soubry here - last time there was just 389 votes between them.

issues.economy: The cost-of-living crisis, with policies fixing it with frozen energy bills and raising the minimum wage.
issues.health: NHS improvements including more doctors and nurses, and quicker GP appointments.
issues.immigration: Immigration controls to prevent new migrants from claiming benefits for two years.

housing.content: Building 200,000 new homes a year. Creating more apprenticeships, and 8,000 more GPs and 20,000 more nurses.

images.caption: Image of Nick Palmer with a brief description of his background and party affiliation.
